intro: Poecilanthe amazonica, commonly known as the Amazonian starflower, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its stems are woody and branched.
